member.name: T:Inversion.Process.Behaviour.IProcessBehaviour
member.summary: The base type for behaviours in Conclave. Behaviours are intended to be registered against a context such as using `ProcessContext.Register(behaviour)`.

remarks.para: When events are fired against that context, each behaviour registered will apply it's condition to the being fired. If this condition returns `true`, then the context will apply the behaviours `Action` against the event.
Care should be taken to ensure behaviours are well behaved. To this end the following contract is implied by use of `IProcessBehaviour`:-

member.name: T:Inversion.Process.IProcessContext

The action to use as the behaviours action.

member.name: T:Inversion.Process.ProcessTimer
member.summary: Represents a simplistic timer as a start and stop time as a pair of date time objects.
member.remarks: This is **NOT** suitable for adult timings, but introduces no overhead and is suitable for applications developers to be able to monitor basic timings of features to know if features are costing more time that expected or are going into distress.

member.name: T:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext
member.summary: Provides a processing context as a self-contained and sufficient channel of application execution. The context manages a set of behaviours and mediates between them and the outside world.
member.remarks: The process context along with the `IBehaviour` objects registered on its bus *are* Inversion. Everything else is chosen convention about how those behaviours interact with each other via the context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.#ctor(Inversion.Process.IServiceContainer,Inversion.Data.IResourceAdapter)
member.summary: Instantiates a new process contrext for inversion.
member.remarks: You can think of this type here as "being Inversion". This is the thing.
member.param: The service container the context will use.
The resources available to the context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Finalize
member.summary: Desrtructor for the type.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources maintained by the current context instance.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposal that allows for partitioning of clean-up of managed and unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This is looking conceited and should probably be removed. I'm not even sure I can explain a use case for it in terms of an Inversion context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Register(Inversion.Process.Behaviour.IProcessBehaviour)
member.summary: Registers a behaviour with the context ensuring it is consulted for each event fired on this context.
member.param: The behaviour to register with this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Register(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Inversion.Process.Behaviour.IProcessBehaviour})
member.summary: Registers a whole bunch of behaviours with this context ensuring each one is consulted when an event is fired on this context.
member.param: The behaviours to register with this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Register(System.Predicate{Inversion.Process.IEvent},System.Action{Inversion.Process.IEvent,Inversion.Process.IProcessContext})
member.summary: Creates and registers a runtime behaviour with this context constructed from a predicate representing the behaviours condition, and an action representing the behaviours action. This behaviour will be consulted for any event fired on this context.
member.param: The predicate to use as the behaviours condition.
The action to use as the behaviours action.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Fire(Inversion.Process.IEvent)
member.summary: Fires an event on the context. Each behaviour registered with context is consulted in no particular order, and for each behaviour that has a condition that returns true when applied to the event, that behaviours action is executed.
member.param: The event to fire on this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Fire(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a simple event, with a simple string message and fires it on this context.
member.param: The message to assign to the event.
member.returns: Returns the event that was constructed and fired on this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Fire(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Constructs an event using the message specified, and using the dictionary provided to populate the parameters of the event. This event is then fired on this context.
member.param: The message to assign to the event.
The parameters to populate the event with.
member.returns: Returns the event that was constructed and fired on this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.FireWith(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Contructs an event with the message specified, using the supplied parameter keys to copy parameters from the context to the constructed event. This event is then fired on this context.
member.param: The message to assign to the event.
The parameters to copy from the context.
member.returns: Returns the event that was constructed and fired on this context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Process.SimpleProcessContext.Completed
member.summary: Instructs the context that operations have finished, and that while it may still be consulted no further events will be fired.
